entry.title: Can We Count on Your Help in a Child's Fight Against Cancer?
entry.content:
Santa Clarita Valley, one of our own needs your help. Can we count our your support in our upcoming blood drive to help young Hayes Unruh fight cancer?

Buying a Santa Clarita home? Get a Full Home Search
 Selling your Santa Clarita home? Get a Free Home Price Evaluation

Sometimes we need to push real estate aside and focus on things in life that really matter.

Unfortunately, a friend of mine received the incredibly difficult news recently that his three-and-a-half-year-old son Hayes was diagnosed with high-risk stage four neuroblastoma cancer.

As a father of two kids of seven and four years, it really rocked my world to hear what Hayes and his family are going through. I can't even imagine getting that news, but the strength and optimism their family has shown has been nothing short of inspiring. I knew I had to help because if I was in the same spot, this family and the whole community would jump in to help too.

Hayesâ€™ father, Chace Unruh, is a local chiropractor who has healed a lot of people and is a huge philanthropist in the local area. I wanted to share the message that he shared with me:

"On April 4th, our youngest son Hayes, three years old, was diagnosed with stage four high-risk neuroblastoma. We always knew he was one in a million, but it turns out that he's one in 7 million. He's always been strong, healthy, and super active. He began doing his 'super kicks' in utero and earned the name Crazy â€˜Hayesyâ€™ before he was even born.

We have been overwhelmed with prayers and offers of help from our family, friends, church, and caring community as a whole. We are so thankful and grateful for the gifts, blood donations, and most of all, your prayers. Our heavenly Father sees our need and our tears and will carry us through this.

Hayes is currently undergoing his second round of chemo and is so far handling it like the brave little guy that he is. According to the wonderful doctors at CHLA Children's Hospital, he has a long road ahead, but we believe in miracles and we are determined to keep life as normal and fun as possible for him and the rest of the family.

'My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever' - Psalm 73:26."

There's something about the Santa Clarita Valley community, the state of California, and the country as a whole that, as crazy as we may be, when we face a difficult obstacle, we all tend to pull together quickly and set our differences aside so we can help each other out in the tough times. That's why I want to ask for your help in helping the incredible Unruh family.
Help us show Hayes that he has our unconditional support.
On Wednesday, May 24 we're having Children's Hospital come out and set up 100 time slots for people to donate blood. Hayes has a long battle ahead of him and we need as much blood as possible. My goal is to load that signup list with all 100 spots and then some.

Even if you're not a blood type match, they can trade it out for other people. Any donations helps Hayes or other people in his situation. All you need to do is mention Hayes' name and his birthday, and that blood will be dedicated to him.

If you have any questions or concerns at all, don't hesitate to contact me. We'll do whatever it takes to get you there, whether that's sending an Uber, a taxi, or personally picking you up myself! We want to do everything we can to support Hayes and the Unruh family.

Let's go to work and show this amazing child and his family that we've got their back. We appreciate your time and support!

link.title: Can We Count on Your Help in a Child's Fight Against Cancer?

entry.title: How 'Pastor Bill' Tried to Scam Our Sellers' Home
entry.content:
There's an online real estate scam sweeping the nation that we wanted to make you aware of. The moral of this story is that if something in real estate seems too good to be true, it almost certainly is.

Buying a Santa Clarita home? Get a Full Home Search
 Selling your Santa Clarita home? Get a Free Home Price Evaluation

There's a real estate scam going around right now that we wanted to make sure you were aware of. We even experienced it firsthand here at our office, but luckily, were able to catch it before anything bad happened. The Internet has made these scams a lot more prevalent than they have been in the past.

In this case, we had a listing that we started getting calls and emails about in bunches. Many of them came from out of state. These callers and emails would ask if the property 'was still up for lease' because someone named 'Pastor Bill' was renting it out. Not only was someone falsely saying he was leasing our seller's property out, he called himself a pastor to make it seem safer.
'Pastor Bill' tried to 'lease' properties owned by our sellers.
'Pastor Bill' asked for an immediate $1,200 deposit because he had to get out of town quickly and get the property rented to maintain his income. It seems like common sense that this was a scam, but sometimes people can get desperate when they need to get into a home quickly. 'Pastor Bill' made it more appealing by offering to lease this property well below the market price, too. Unfortunately, people get scammed and end up sending checks to this criminal.

We've even heard stories about people showing up to a house with their things in a moving van, excited to move into the house. Needless to say, the real owners get understandably confused.

The moral of the story is that if you see a rental property that seems too good to be true, it probably is. Make sure you ask a lot of questions and do your due diligence. Get your agent involved, too. We can help prevent these situations. If you have any questions about renting property or about any real estate topics, don't hesitate to give us a call right away. We'd be more than happy to help.

link.title: How 'Pastor Bill' Tried to Scam Our Sellers' Home

entry.title: How Will the Election Affect the Real Estate Market?
entry.content:
Here is the effect Iâ€™m predicting that this particular election will have on the real estate market on a local and national scale.

Buying a Santa Clarita home? Get a Full Home Search
 Selling your Santa Clairta home? Get a Free Home Price Evaluation

With the presidential election coming up quickly, Iâ€™d like to answer the question I get most frequently: â€œHow will the election affect both our local real estate market and the market nationally?â€
My answer to this question is simply, â€œNothing.â€ History has shown us that immediately after an election, the market does not see much of a change. The most important factor that we have to keep our eyes on is how consumer confidence is affected by this election, as this will be one of the few parts of the real estate market that is impacted.
What we know is that in the midst of political chaos and controversy, the main motivator for most people, by and large, is fear. Fear usually causes one of two possible outcomes: action or inaction.
The election should have no immediate impact on our market.
When there is fear and uncertainty in the market due to the election, people who might otherwise list their home are keeping their homes off the market. Likewise, some people who may not have been considering listing their homes have done so out of fear. Itâ€™s hard to predict exactly what effect this election will have on our market in the end.
We also know that interest rates arenâ€™t going to increase immediately and that home prices wonâ€™t fluctuate drastically either. Overall, the election should have no immediate impact on the real estate market, but the fear and uncertainty about this election may have an impact on the market in the future.
If you have any other questions about what to expect from the Santa Clarita Valley market in the future or how long you have left to take advantage of the uptick weâ€™re seeing right now, give me a call or send me an email. I look forward to talking with you soon!

entry.title: Tips for Buying & Selling a Home at the Same Time
entry.content:
If you are thinking of buying a home but need to sell your current house at the same time, we recommend using a contingency sale.

Buying a Santa Clarita home? Get a Full Home Search
 Selling your Santa Clairta home? Get a Free Home Price Evaluation

Many people want to sell their homes but are afraid of buying a home at the same time. They worry that they wonâ€™t find the right property in time and a lot of people donâ€™t move forward with the process because they are worried about finding temporary housing or ending up homeless.

However, you can still buy a new home and sell your current one at the same time by using a contingency sale. Contingency sales allow you to get out there, test the market, and put yourself in a great position to sell your home without the fear of ending up homeless.

You can get your home on the market, market the home properly, and bring in a buyer. Then, weâ€™ll figure out what price we can get for your home. While weâ€™re doing all of that, we are also out there searching for your next home.

Donâ€™t avoid selling because you
are worried about finding your next home.
The great thing about contingency sales is that if we donâ€™t have a house that youâ€™re happy with and want to move into, you donâ€™t have to sell your home. You can back out of the deal during the negotiation period at no cost and no penalty to you.

Donâ€™t avoid selling because
you are worried about finding
your next home. There are a lot of great opportunities out there for home sellers. The market has gone up, people have equity in their properties, and most people are now in a great position to downsize or upgrade depending on their situation.

If you want to get into something more manageable or move up into your dream home, a contingency sale is a great way to do so with zero risk. Even if the buyer is willing to pay the amount you want, if you cannot find your next home, you can back out of the deal with no penalty and you wonâ€™t be left without a home.

If you have any questions about this process, give us a call or send us an email. We have been doing a lot of contingency sales lately, so we can run you through all of the pros and cons of the process. We would be happy to help you!

entry.title: Why Are Real Estate Trusts So Important?
entry.content:
Buying a Santa Clarita home? Get a Full Home Search
 Selling your Santa Clairta home? Get a Free Home Price Evaluation

Lately, weâ€™ve been hearing a lot about real estate trusts. Whether you are setting a trust up for yourself or your parents, setting up a trust is a great idea.

We have run into many scenarios lately where assets such as residential or commercial real estate are not properly set up. When you leave a property to a designated family member, you need to put the property in a trust or you will have to go through probate court.

Even if you think you are all set up, itâ€™s best to double check. Unfortunately, there are many people out there running scams on property trusts. Check in with your parents or grandparents to make sure everything is in place.
Real estate trusts help you avoid months of probate court.
These conversations are tough, but they are also incredibly important. Estate and property issues are the last things you want when you are coming together as a family to remember the life of a loved one.

Probate court can take at least six months and will cost you a lot of money in attorney fees. To avoid probate, we can put you in touch with a great estate or trust attorney so that you know your property trust is set up correctly.

If you have any other questions about property trusts or real estate in general, give us a call or send us an email. We would be happy to help you!

link.title: Why Are Real Estate Trusts So Important?

entry.title: Whatâ€™s Happening in the Santa Clarita Real Estate Market?
entry.content:
Looking at the numbers, the Santa Clarita market is heavily favoring sellers. However, as youâ€™ll see, thereâ€™s plenty of opportunity for buyers as well.

Buying a Santa Clarita home? Get a Full Home Search
 Selling your Santa Clairta home? Get a Free Home Price Evaluation

Whatâ€™s happening out there in our Santa Clarita market?

Our active inventory is moving in a positive direction. A lot of people are listing their homes because they feel that weâ€™re getting near the top of the market. A lot of people are also still buying homes. Last month, we had 361 homes sell. There are currently 589 active home listings in Santa Clarita, and 605 that are in escrow.

At this pace, things are still moving fast enough to keep inventory at a low level. In a normal market here in Santa Clarita, we average between 1,000 to 1,400 available homes. As you can see, weâ€™re still far below the number that we need to be in a balanced, average market.
There are great opportunities for both buyers and sellers.
Looking strictly at the numbers, weâ€™re in an extreme sellerâ€™s market. However, buyers are getting pickier and pickier. We arenâ€™t seeing as many multiple offer situations, but because interest rates are still so low, there are still a lot of opportunities out there for both buyers and sellers.

If you have any other real estate questions or want to know more about our market, donâ€™t hesitate to give us a call or send us an email. We look forward to talking to you soon!
